channel.title: Talk Radio Meltdown
channel.description: Talk Radio Meltdown is a free podcast and uncensored talk radio show from Boston, MA. Host Jack Gill and a quasi-rotating cast of nobodies share the latest buzz in pop culture and outlandish news stories. We invite you to listen; we hope you enjoy. www.talkradiomeltdown.com
channel.itunes:author: Jack Gill
channel.itunes:subtitle: Talk Radio Meltdown | Boston Podcast | Uncensored Talk Radio

channel.itunes:keywords: Talk radio meltdown, boston, radioyouboston, jack gill

item.title: 6/4/12 - Episode 161
item.description:
Following a two-week break and a brief moment of fear when we realized he might not have our new call-in number, CHRIS JONES (designer of the “Tex Murphy” video game series) joined us for an HOUR-LONG interview! He’s a pretty classy guy, and very strict when it comes to downloadable content. You’ll have to listen in to hear what he has to say.
For all of you lazy folks out there, we made sure we did the interview first thing, so you don’t have to listen to the hard-hitting discussion about zombies and the new “Prometheus” movie that we had after Chris got off the phone with us. Enjoy! - www.talkradiomeltdown.com
item.itunes:author: Jack Gill, Katie Crepeau, Mike Tarara, Jimmy Park

item.title: 5/18/12 - Episode 160
item.description: TALK RADIO MELTDOWN + THE ACC AND JACK SHOW! Acc and Jack join forces once again to discuss video games, the return of Toonami, and Acc’s fear of public bathrooms. Jack also eulogizes WFNX, one of Boston’s most prolific radio stations that’s fallen victim to the corporate beast. - www.talkradiomeltdown.com

item.title: 5/15/12 - Episode 158
item.description: This was assembled in parts, partly due to software issues and overall fear of losing this awesome recording, but you will enjoy it nonetheless. We recorded this show live from The Tavern in Framingham, MA – Demick O’Brien and Fatty the Cable Guy joined us. We got drunk and had the time of our lives. Please listen to this in its entirety and enjoy; from the second hour on is the money maker. - www.talkradiomeltdown.com

item.title: 5/8/12 - Episode 157
item.description:
A rock station in Baltimore ripped us off after one of their morning guy’s spilled coffee in to their on-air board; the end result of that was far more hilarious and debilitating than when Jack spilled beer in to his own mixer. We also broke the news towards the end of the show that Tom Gabel from Against Me! is pursuing a sex change operation, which ultimately makes him cooler than the entire state of North Carolina.
Peace to Adam Yauch and Maurice Sendak. - www.talkradiomeltdown.com
item.itunes:author: Jack Gill, Katie Crepeau, Mike Tarara, Jimmy Park

item.title: TRM's Money Shots - April 2012
item.description: Here’s some stuff we did in April: An hour-long interview with JAKE NODAR from History Channel’s “FULL METAL JOUSTING” / Sweet Brown (“Ain’t nobody got time fo’ ‘dat!”) / Tupac Shakur: The Hologram / An hour-long interview with actor/director ADAM GREEN / Ripping on local area commercials (“With these prices, I should be broke!”) / We top off this four-hour-long monster episode of Money Shots with the infamous “first version” of Episode 154, in all of its beer-soaked, drunken, unbalanced mess. Enjoy! - www.talkradiomeltdown.com

item.title: 5/1/12 - Episode 156
item.description: For two years, we have talked about getting a microphone that we could snake in to our neighboring bathroom, to pot up whenever Kate or anyone would enter. The reason lies in the fact that whoever decides to use the bathroom while we are on-air continues to talk, even though none of the console microphones can pick them up. That all changed with Episode 156. Listen through, and enjoy. - www.talkradiomeltdown.com
item.itunes:author: Jack Gill, Chris Froment, Katie Crepeau, Mike Tarara, Jimmy Park

item.title: 4/17/12 - Episode 154
item.description:
I’m going to have to explain this show to you, because you’ll be really confused otherwise:
I invited a friend, Charles, over for this show. We recorded an entire 90-minute show, but Charles ended up drinking a little too much and, essentially, we had to end the show early. I also spilled an entire bottle of beer in to our mixing console and effectively trashed it right at the start of the show.
We reconvened later that night and re-did Episode 154, both without Charles and with the faulty mixer. We liked this version, so we posted it. Enjoy! - www.talkradiomeltdown.com
item.itunes:author: Jack Gill, Chris Froment, Katie Crepeau, Mike Tarara, Jimmy Park

item.title: 2/14/12 - Episode 147
item.description:
We (or rather, Kate) interviewed voice actress Tara Strong! You may remember her from every cartoon and video game ever made… well, almost. She does have a very long resume.
Before you hear our discussion with her, you will have to stomach our thoughts on the death of Whitney Houston. Kate also tells a hate-filled story about how she and an army of people got two full rows of girls kicked out of a sold-out movie. Listen and enjoy! - www.talkradiomeltdown.com

item.title: Webcomics on Ice 2011
item.description:
Jack, Acc, and Red attended “Webcomics on Ice 2011″ in Easthampton, MA this past weekend. It was truly a nerd-fest, with authors of great webcomics in attendance and (free!) retro arcade games galore. We had a chance to awkwardly interview a few of these authors – in this podcast, you’ll hear us talk with:
Ryan North (Dinosaur Comics) and Chris Hastings (Dr. McNinja) Andrew Hussie (MS Paint Adventures) and Byron Hussie (byrobot.net) KC Green (Gunshow) Jeph Jacques (Questionable Content)
Photos of our interviews can be seen on our FACEBOOK page! - www.talkradiomeltdown.com

item.title: 11/30/10 - Episode 84
item.description:
Let’s try a new style of writing when it comes to summarizing our podcasts.
Nate Fillers joined us for our first live show on EdgeFM.net. We talked about taking massive shits on our favorite female celebrities, including Ellie Kemper and Katie Holmes. A man evidently goes blind every time he has sex. We honor the life of the greatest actor who ever lived, Leslie Nielsen. Jack saw “The Room” for the first time over the weekend, and we discussed how bad it really is. Willie Nelson got busted for pot possession, and that led us to talk about the new controversial TSA screenings. We end the show reliving our high school nightmares, because we all had them. Oh, and we also played music from Nate’s epic project, “Sbassbear.” - www.talkradiomeltdown.com
